segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how oblivious the woman is to the water everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s just standing there, drying dishes like it’s a normal day.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, trying to get cookies without her noticing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool like he’s a circus performer.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I bet he’s going to drop a cookie or two, and the girl will scramble to pick them up.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring over the sink, but she doesn’t even glance at it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll slip and fall before she even realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so nice, but inside, it’s pure comedy.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the kids are going to get away with it, and the woman will never know.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is just too funny to me.
segments.speaker: PAR
